body_content.explanation: to accept or absorb an idea, opinion, belief, etc. so that it becomes part of your character:
examples: He had not expected the people so readily to internalize the values of democracy.

body_content.explanation: If you internalize your emotions or feelings, you do not allow them to show although you think about them:
examples: Many women tend to internalize their anxiety and distress.

body_content.explanation: to include something when calculating the cost of a product or activity:
examples: A fair energy market would include a greater emphasis on internalizing environmental costs.
You will get more willingness to sue when the costs of trial aren't internalized by the party making the decision to go to trial.
